result.execSummary:
The defendant James M. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Wavier of preliminary hearing/arraignment/plea/sentencing held 1/7/15

Defendant James M. Miller in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant James M. Miller in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF405, 14CF120 (sentencing hearing) and 14CF408 (Preliminary Hearing, Plea Hearing and Sentencing Hearing all heard today).

1:36 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

14CF408:
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial in Branch 1.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No Contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and Count's 2 & 3 are DRI on case 14CF408.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date on 14CF408.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Knaapen does not have any corrections to the PSI.
Atty Sheets does not have any corrections to the PSI.
Atty Knaapen states that 14CF120 had been plead to but is not listed on face sheet of PSI.
Atty Sheets references Page 6 on the PSI as stated on the record.
Court makes changes on his copy of the PSI.
Neither party will be providing any evidence.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Court interrupts and states that Pre-Trial Supervision Report had been provided; State has received a copy and makes statements that the date is incorrect.
Atty Sheets has received his copy of the Pre-Trial Supervison Report also.
Atty Knaapen provides the Court with his copy of the Pre-Trial Supervison Report.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.


Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets  makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements on his behalf prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
13CF405:
Count 1 -
Impose 5.5 year prison sentence with 2 years 6 months initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision
Not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program.
Participate in Sex Offender Program as deemed appropriate
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Comply with continued alcohol and drug treatment 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Pay Fine of $1,200.00 + applicable costs
Pay $26.45 for Blood Draw
Pay DNA Surcharge
36 months DL Revocation
36 month IID effective today's date
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain/Obtain full-time employment.
Pay within 60 days or set up payment plan
**cash bond to be applied to fines/costs.

Count 2 - Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion

14CF120:
Count 1 -
Serve 6 months in County Jail conccurent with 13CF405
Pay fine of $500.00 + applicable costs
Pay DNA Surcharge 
Pay within 60 days or set up payment plan
**cash bond to be applied to fines/costs

14CF408:
Count 1 -
Serve 6 months in the County Jail concurrent with 13CF405 and 14CF120
Pay costs

Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

**21 days jail credit on all 3 files.
Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report
Sentencing hearing on January 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James M. Miller in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 13CF-405, 14CF-120 and 14CF-216.

10:43 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Address is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
13CF-405: Defendant will plead to Count 1. 6 yr prision -3 yrs initial, 3 yrs extended, imposed and stayed - 3 yrs prob, 9 mo jail, $1,200 fine plus costs, $26.45 blood draw, AODA, 36 mo rev, 36 mo IID commencing today.   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license and in compliance. Obtn/mtn ft emt, other counseling. Cash bond to be applied against fine/costs. Provide DNA sample if not already done so, pay DNA surcharge.
14CF-120: Defendant will plead to single count - whhld sent, 3 yrs prob, same conditions, no additional jail time, $500 fine plus costs. Cash bond to be applied
14CF-216: State recommends case be dismissed and read in.

Parties are willing to proceed without one if the Court wishes to proceed.
Court states that a PSI will most likely be ordered.

Atty Sheets concurs with the recommendation, requests a PSI not be ordered.
Defendant concurs with the recommendation.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST 13CF-405 Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CF-120

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
BAC : .146
Atty Sheets acknowledges previous convictions.
Court takes a moment to review the complaints. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
13CF-405 Count 1: OWI 6th offense
13CF-405 Count 2: Dismissed
14CF-120: Felony Bailjumping
14CF-216: Dismissed 


Court is hesitant to go to sentencing without a PSI. These are serious charges.  Defendant violated conditions of bond. 
Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, there was an ATTIC report. Defense received a copy as well, dated September 26th.
Atty Knaapen's office did receive a referral for more misses, has not gotten it filed before today.
Court did receive the ATTIC report, reviews this report.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI.

Court will set matter for sentencing. 

BY THE COURT:
Court orders Defendant to continue following bond.

PSI to be available to the parties by December 30th.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on October 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant James M Miller in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant James M Miller in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 13CF405, 14CF120, 14CF216

Atty Sheets makes statements.  Defendant has received a new charge.  Not prepared to enter a plea today. 
Atty Knaapen indicates 14CF216 is the reason the defendant has been in custody. Asks to proceed to Initial Appearance on that file today. 

14CF216 Initial Appearance is conducted.  *see minutes in that file*

Court will set a pre-trial on these matters. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on August 18, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
Written
Plea hearing on October 21, 2014 at 10:30 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

Bond Continued

Defendant James M. Miller in court with attorney Eric P Sheets. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.

Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant James M. Miller in court with attorney Eric P. Sheets. Veronica Fay Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.

DA case #14PT593
Court calls case at  1:23 p.m.
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  Defendant is on bond on 13CF405.
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jump-fel.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendant.
State requests $2,000 cash bond:  Comply with conditions as stated in 13CF405. Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Defendant requests a lower cash bond and says he would lose his job.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:    @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch

$2,000 cash bond:  Comply with conditions as stated in 13CF405. Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
